jd: From: Muskan, infotech muskan.sharma@infotechspectrum.com Reply to: muskan.sharma@infotechspectrum.com HiBusiness AnalystREMOTE/Hybrid(2 days a week) if local to Houston – let’s try local 1st.NEED to have: oil & gas experience Experience level- no more than 5 years needed- doesn’t need someone to come in and tell them how to change things, we are backfilling someone that was too senior of a BA from another agency that didn’t work out. Must be able to write their own user stories and have a team mentality. **Key Responsibilities:** - Collaborate with stakeholders to understand and document business requirements.- Write clear and concise user stories that capture functional and non-functional requirements.- Facilitate workshops and meetings to elicit requirements and prioritize features.- Conduct gap analysis and process mapping to identify opportunities for improvement.- Develop and maintain documentation, including business process flows and use cases.- Work closely with development teams to ensure user stories are understood and implemented correctly.- Assist in user acceptance testing (UAT) to validate that the final product meets business needs.- Provide ongoing support and act as a liaison between business units and technical teams.- Stay up-to-date with industry trends and best practices in business analysis. **Qualifications:** - Bachelor’s degree in Business Administration, Information Technology, or a related field.- Proven experience as a Business Analyst, preferably in the oil and gas or engineering sectors.- Strong understanding of Agile methodologies and experience writing user stories.- Excellent analytical, problem-solving, and communication skills.- Proficiency in tools for requirement gathering and documentation – uses ADO- Ability to work independently and manage multiple priorities in a fast-paced environment.- Familiarity with project management principles is a plus.
